intro: Oxygonum calcaratum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oxygonum calcaratum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
